intro: Diospyros lecardii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre persimmon, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Ebenaceae family, which includes other persimmon species. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are followed by small, round fruits that mature to a red-orange color. Diospyros lecardii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and canyons.
